prerequisite.name: xTuple ERP version
prerequisite.query: WITH version AS ( SELECT (SELECT substring(fetchMetricText('ServerVersion'),E'^([[:digit:]]+)\..*'))::integer as major_version, (SELECT substring(fetchMetricText('ServerVersion'),E'^[[:digit:]]+\.([[:digit:]]+)\..*$'))::integer as minor_version, (SELECT substring(fetchMetricText('ServerVersion'),E'^[[:digit:]]+\.[[:digit:]]+\.([[:digit:]]+)'))::integer as patch_version ) SELECT (major_version = 4 AND minor_version = 10 AND patch_version >= 1) OR (major_version = 4 AND minor_version > 10) OR (major_version > 4) FROM version;
prerequisite.message: This package must be installed against xTuple ERP version 4.10.1 or later. This package has only been tested against version 4.10.1 and may not work in later version without updating.

prerequisite.name: Muse Systems xTuple Utilities
prerequisite.query: WITH version AS ( SELECT (SELECT substring(pkghead_version,E'^([[:digit:]]+)\..*'))::integer as major_version, (SELECT substring(pkghead_version,E'^[[:digit:]]+\.([[:digit:]]+)\..*$'))::integer as minor_version, (SELECT substring(pkghead_version,E'^[[:digit:]]+\.[[:digit:]]+\.([[:digit:]]+)'))::integer as patch_version FROM pkghead WHERE pkghead_name = 'musextputils' ) SELECT (major_version = 2 AND minor_version = 4 AND patch_version >= 0) OR (major_version = 2 AND minor_version > 4) OR (major_version > 2) FROM version;
prerequisite.message: This package requires that the Muse Systems xTuple Utilities version 2.2.0 or any higher version 1 series is installed prior to installation of this package.

package.loadpriv: Grants the user the ability to create, remove, or modify super charateristics. This permission is typically assigned to power users who are capable of managing user defined data. This permission does not confer the ability to create or remove super characteristic groups, but does allow for the management of super characteristic to group assignments.

Grants a user the ability to maintain combobox/select list queries. This permission is highly security sensitive as it will allow entry of arbitrary SQL which will be executed in the context of the end user that is making use of such a super characteristic. As such this permission should only ever be granted to those with a pre-existing high level of trust. To use this privilege, a user must also have the maintainSuperCharacteristic privilege.

Grants the user privileges to user the user interface to manipulate charateristics which are typically only managed via extension packages. We stronly recommend that this permission not be regularly granted to any users. The permission is granted only for the purposes of development convenience and emergency system fixes. This privilege is best thought of as the privilege to break your system.

Grants the user the ability to update "internal" names of Super Characteristic objects that have them. This is sensitive because internal names may be used in external reporting or programmings and would be broken by ad hoc, ill-considered changes. Normally, you really want to consider an internal name fixed once it is created (in other words, we recommend not granting this permission to anyone.)

Grants a user the ability to add or remove "entities" as being valid for super characteristics. An entity is another table within the system. Note that this is a sensitive permission since removing an entity from recognition also deletes and super characteristic data for that entity.
Grants a user the ability to maintain super characteristic groups, specifically creating or deleting groups.
